The reason is because errors are being logged, and the
ReadOnlyConfigurationTests check if changes happen in the file system.

The errors appear below. It seems EclipseStarter is trying to install bundles
already installed by update.

Will attach full log.

Created an attachment (id=19701)
full log

This log comes from running in a different machine (different paths etc).

Test and test harness were fixed.

The problem was due the fact that the default value for
osgi.configuration.cascaded is actually true (the test expected it to be false).
This way, a default shared configuration was computed (based on the install
location), so all plug-ins from the parent location were already known by the
framework. Fix was to force osgi.configuration.cascaded to false.

What exactly uncovered the problem is unknown. Initially thought it was related
to the new support for location independent configurations, but could not find
any proof of that.

traces.message: Bundle "org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility" version "3.1.0" has already been installed from: update@/c:/eclipse/dev/i0405/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility_3.1.0/
